name: Confirmation bias
funny_summary: You see what supports your story and ignore the rest.
description: The tendency to search for, interpret, and remember information that confirms preexisting beliefs.

sources.title: Wason (1960) On the failure to eliminate hypotheses
Nickerson (1998) Confirmation bias: A ubiquitous phenomenon

name: Anchoring bias
funny_summary: The first number you see anchors your mind.
description: Overreliance on an initial piece of information when making decisions.
name_origin: Metaphor of an anchor fixing judgment.

sources.title: Tversky & Kahneman (1974) Judgment under Uncertainty: Heuristics and Biases

name: Availability heuristic
funny_summary: If it comes to mind easily, it's probably common.
description: Estimating frequency or probability by the ease with which examples can be recalled.

sources.title: Tversky & Kahneman (1973) Availability: A heuristic for judging frequency and probability

name: Bandwagon effect
funny_summary: A common cognitive tendency called Bandwagon effect.
description: See primary sources for detailed explanation of Bandwagon effect.

name: Framing effect
funny_summary: Same facts, different frame — different choice.
description: Decisions are influenced by how options are presented, e.g., as gains or losses.

sources.title: Tversky & Kahneman (1981) The framing of decisions and the psychology of choice

name: Halo effect
funny_summary: One shine, everything shines.
description: Overall positive impression skews judgments about specific traits.
name_origin: Metaphor of a halo spreading positivity.

sources.title: Thorndike (1920) A Constant Error in Psychological Ratings

name: Self-serving bias
funny_summary: A common cognitive tendency called Self-serving bias.
description: See primary sources for detailed explanation of Self-serving bias.

name: Sunk cost fallacy
funny_summary: Too invested to quit.
description: Continuing an endeavor due to prior investments despite poor future prospects.

sources.title: Arkes & Blumer (1985) The psychology of sunk costs

name: Negativity bias
funny_summary: Bad news weighs more than good news.
description: Greater psychological impact of negative events relative to positive ones.

sources.title: Baumeister et al. (2001) Bad is stronger than good

name: Optimism bias
funny_summary: A common cognitive tendency called Optimism bias.
description: See primary sources for detailed explanation of Optimism bias.

name: Dunning–Kruger effect
funny_summary: If you're bad, you think you're good.
description: Incompetent individuals overestimate their abilities; experts may underestimate theirs.

name: Status quo bias
funny_summary: A common cognitive tendency called Status quo bias.
description: See primary sources for detailed explanation of Status quo bias.

name: Endowment effect
funny_summary: Yours is more valuable than identical not-yours.
description: Ownership increases perceived value of an item.

sources.title: Kahneman, Knetsch & Thaler (1990) Experimental tests of the endowment effect

name: Hindsight bias
funny_summary: A common cognitive tendency called Hindsight bias.
description: See primary sources for detailed explanation of Hindsight bias.

name: Representativeness heuristic
funny_summary: If it looks like the prototype, it must be that.
description: Judging probabilities by similarity to a prototype rather than base rates.

name: Gambler's fallacy
funny_summary: Past outcomes affect future random chances — they don't.
description: Belief that independent random events are affected by previous outcomes.

name: Planning fallacy
funny_summary: We always think we’ll finish sooner than we do.
description: Underestimating time, costs, and risks of future activities.

sources.title: Buehler, Griffin & Ross (1994) Exploring the planning fallacy

name: Illusion of control
funny_summary: A common cognitive tendency called Illusion of control.
description: See primary sources for detailed explanation of Illusion of control.

name: Authority bias
funny_summary: A common cognitive tendency called Authority bias.
description: See primary sources for detailed explanation of Authority bias.

name: Choice-supportive bias
funny_summary: A common cognitive tendency called Choice-supportive bias.
description: See primary sources for detailed explanation of Choice-supportive bias.

name: Loss aversion
funny_summary: Losses hurt more than equal gains please.
description: People prefer avoiding losses over acquiring equivalent gains.
name_origin: From prospect theory emphasizing losses' weight.

sources.title: Kahneman & Tversky (1979) Prospect Theory: An analysis of decision under risk

name: Projection bias
funny_summary: A common cognitive tendency called Projection bias.
description: See primary sources for detailed explanation of Projection bias.

name: In-group bias
funny_summary: A common cognitive tendency called In-group bias.
description: See primary sources for detailed explanation of In-group bias.

name: Out-group homogeneity bias
funny_summary: A common cognitive tendency called Out-group homogeneity bias.
description: See primary sources for detailed explanation of Out-group homogeneity bias.

name: Fundamental attribution error
funny_summary: They did it because they're that kind of person.
description: Overemphasizing personality factors and underestimating situational influences when judging others.

sources.title: Ross (1977) The intuitive psychologist and his shortcomings

name: Actor–observer bias
funny_summary: A common cognitive tendency called Actor–observer bias.
description: See primary sources for detailed explanation of Actor–observer bias.

sources.title: Jones & Nisbett (1971) The actor and the observer

name: Availability cascade
funny_summary: If it comes to mind easily, it's probably common.
description: Estimating frequency or probability by the ease with which examples can be recalled.

sources.title: Kuran & Sunstein (1999) Availability cascades and risk regulation

name: Cognitive dissonance
funny_summary: Two truths clash; the brain invents harmony.
description: Psychological discomfort from holding conflicting beliefs, prompting attitude or behavior change.

sources.title: Festinger (1957) A Theory of Cognitive Dissonance

name: False consensus effect
funny_summary: A common cognitive tendency called False consensus effect.
description: See primary sources for detailed explanation of False consensus effect.

name: Just-world hypothesis
funny_summary: A common cognitive tendency called Just-world hypothesis.
description: See primary sources for detailed explanation of Just-world hypothesis.

sources.title: Lerner (1980) The belief in a just world

name: Hot-hand fallacy
funny_summary: A common cognitive tendency called Hot-hand fallacy.
description: See primary sources for detailed explanation of Hot-hand fallacy.

name: Recency effect
funny_summary: A common cognitive tendency called Recency effect.
description: See primary sources for detailed explanation of Recency effect.

name: Primacy effect
funny_summary: A common cognitive tendency called Primacy effect.
description: See primary sources for detailed explanation of Primacy effect.

name: Spotlight effect
funny_summary: A common cognitive tendency called Spotlight effect.
description: See primary sources for detailed explanation of Spotlight effect.

name: Contrast effect
funny_summary: A common cognitive tendency called Contrast effect.
description: See primary sources for detailed explanation of Contrast effect.

name: Regression to the mean
funny_summary: A common cognitive tendency called Regression to the mean.
description: See primary sources for detailed explanation of Regression to the mean.

name: Survivorship bias
funny_summary: A common cognitive tendency called Survivorship bias.
description: See primary sources for detailed explanation of Survivorship bias.

name: Placebo effect
funny_summary: Belief can cause real bodily changes.
description: Improvement due to expectation of benefit rather than active treatment.

name: Ostrich effect
funny_summary: A common cognitive tendency called Ostrich effect.
description: See primary sources for detailed explanation of Ostrich effect.

name: Neglect of probability
funny_summary: A common cognitive tendency called Neglect of probability.
description: See primary sources for detailed explanation of Neglect of probability.

name: Curse of knowledge
funny_summary: Knowing it makes you forget how not to know.
description: Difficulty imagining the perspective of those without one's knowledge.

sources.title: Camerer, Loewenstein & Weber (1989) The curse of knowledge in economic settings

name: Overconfidence effect
funny_summary: A common cognitive tendency called Overconfidence effect.
description: See primary sources for detailed explanation of Overconfidence effect.

sources.title: Moore & Healy (2008) The trouble with overconfidence

name: Mere-exposure effect
funny_summary: A common cognitive tendency called Mere-exposure effect.
description: See primary sources for detailed explanation of Mere-exposure effect.

sources.title: Zajonc (1968) Attitudinal effects of mere exposure

name: Backfire effect
funny_summary: A common cognitive tendency called Backfire effect.
description: See primary sources for detailed explanation of Backfire effect.

name: Decoy effect
funny_summary: A bad option makes another option look great.
description: Introducing a dominated option changes preferences between other choices.

sources.title: Huber, Payne & Puto (1982) Adding asymmetrically dominated alternatives

name: Zero-risk bias
funny_summary: A common cognitive tendency called Zero-risk bias.
description: See primary sources for detailed explanation of Zero-risk bias.

name: Normalization of deviance
funny_summary: A common cognitive tendency called Normalization of deviance.
description: See primary sources for detailed explanation of Normalization of deviance.

name: Groupthink
funny_summary: Harmony wins, truth loses.
description: Group desire for consensus suppresses dissent and critical thinking.

name: Salience bias
funny_summary: A common cognitive tendency called Salience bias.
description: See primary sources for detailed explanation of Salience bias.

name: Action bias
funny_summary: A common cognitive tendency called Action bias.
description: See primary sources for detailed explanation of Action bias.

name: Aesthetic-usability effect
funny_summary: A common cognitive tendency called Aesthetic-usability effect.
description: See primary sources for detailed explanation of Aesthetic-usability effect.

name: Attribute substitution
funny_summary: A common cognitive tendency called Attribute substitution.
description: See primary sources for detailed explanation of Attribute substitution.

name: Base rate fallacy
funny_summary: A common cognitive tendency called Base rate fallacy.
description: See primary sources for detailed explanation of Base rate fallacy.

name: Belief bias
funny_summary: A common cognitive tendency called Belief bias.
description: See primary sources for detailed explanation of Belief bias.

name: Ben Franklin effect
funny_summary: A common cognitive tendency called Ben Franklin effect.
description: See primary sources for detailed explanation of Ben Franklin effect.

sources.title: Jecker & Landy (1969) Liking persons who do us favors

name: Bias blind spot
funny_summary: A common cognitive tendency called Bias blind spot.
description: See primary sources for detailed explanation of Bias blind spot.

name: Bystander effect
funny_summary: More onlookers, less help.
description: Individuals are less likely to help in emergencies when others are present.

name: Cheerleader effect
funny_summary: A common cognitive tendency called Cheerleader effect.
description: See primary sources for detailed explanation of Cheerleader effect.

name: Clustering illusion
funny_summary: A common cognitive tendency called Clustering illusion.
description: See primary sources for detailed explanation of Clustering illusion.

name: Congruence bias
funny_summary: A common cognitive tendency called Congruence bias.
description: See primary sources for detailed explanation of Congruence bias.

name: Conservatism (belief revision)
funny_summary: A common cognitive tendency called Conservatism (belief revision).
description: See primary sources for detailed explanation of Conservatism (belief revision).

funny_summary: A common cognitive tendency called Consistency bias.
description: See primary sources for detailed explanation of Consistency bias.

description: See primary sources for detailed explanation of Focusing effect.

description: See primary sources for detailed explanation of Forer effect (Barnum effect).

funny_summary: A common cognitive tendency called Hard–easy effect.
description: See primary sources for detailed explanation of Hard–easy effect.

name: Herd instinct
funny_summary: A common cognitive tendency called Herd instinct.
description: See primary sources for detailed explanation of Herd instinct.

name: IKEA effect
funny_summary: If you assemble it, you value it more.
description: Overvaluing products one has helped create.

sources.title: Norton, Mochon & Ariely (2012) The IKEA effect

name: Illusory correlation

description: See primary sources for detailed explanation of Illusory correlation.

name: Illusion of explanatory depth
funny_summary: You know more than you do — until asked to explain.
description: Belief that one understands complex topics more deeply than they actually do.

sources.title: Rozenblit & Keil (2002) The misunderstood limits of knowing
